questions.prompt: Which HTML element represents the root of an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The <html> element is the root element of an HTML document and contains all other elements except the <!DOCTYPE> declaration.

questions.prompt: The <meta charset="UTF-8"> tag should be placed inside the <body> element.
questions.explanation: The <meta charset="UTF-8"> tag should be placed in the <head> section, not the <body>. It defines the character encoding for the document.

questions.prompt: Which attribute is required for the element?
questions.explanation: The src attribute is required for elements as it specifies the path to the image. While alt is highly recommended for accessibility, src is technically required.

questions.prompt: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> element with the href attribute is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.prompt: The HTML element used to define the title of a document shown in the browser tab is ___.
questions.explanation: The <title> element, placed in the <head> section, defines the document title shown in the browser tab and search results.

questions.prompt: Which input type provides a date picker in modern browsers?
questions.explanation: The <input type="date"> creates a date picker control in browsers that support it, allowing users to select dates easily.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the "action" attribute in a <form> element?
options: It specifies where to send form data
questions.correctAnswer: It specifies where to send form data
questions.explanation: The action attribute specifies the URL where the form data should be sent when submitted.

questions.prompt: The <label> element can be associated with an input using the "for" attribute that matches the input's "id".
questions.explanation: The for attribute of <label> should match the id of the associated input element, improving accessibility and allowing users to click the label to focus the input.

questions.prompt: Which attribute makes an input field required in HTML5?
questions.explanation: The required attribute is a boolean attribute that prevents form submission if the field is empty.

questions.prompt: To create a dropdown list in HTML, you use the ___ element with nested <option> elements.
questions.explanation: The <select> element creates a dropdown list, containing one or more <option> elements representing the choices.

questions.prompt: Which semantic HTML5 element should be used for a self-contained composition that could be independently distributed?
questions.explanation: <article> represents a self-contained composition intended to be independently distributable or reusable, such as a blog post, news article, or forum post.

questions.prompt: What is the difference between <section> and <div>?
options: <section> is semantic and represents thematic grouping
questions.correctAnswer: <section> is semantic and represents thematic grouping
questions.explanation: <section> is a semantic element representing a thematic grouping of content, while <div> is a generic container with no semantic meaning.

questions.prompt: The <nav> element should only be used for the main navigation block and not for all groups of links.
questions.explanation: The <nav> element should be reserved for major navigation blocks. Not all groups of links need to be in a <nav> element, only sections consisting of major navigation blocks.

questions.prompt: Which element is best for tangentially related content, like a sidebar?
questions.explanation: The <aside> element represents content that is tangentially related to the main content, commonly used for sidebars, pull quotes, or related links.

questions.prompt: The ___ element represents introductory content for its nearest ancestor sectioning content or sectioning root element.
questions.explanation: The <header> element represents introductory content, typically containing headings, logos, navigation, or other introductory information.
